word.entryDescription: to move or travel to a place
word.entryExample: I go to school in London.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: nice or enjoyable
word.entryExample: Have a good time at the party!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: something you say to greet somebody in the afternoon
word.entryExample: Good afternoon, Ms Black! What a lovely day!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: able to do something well
word.entryExample: Are you good at singing?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: something you say to greet somebody in the evening
word.entryExample: Good evening, Mark. Nice to see you.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: making you healthy and well
word.entryExample: Fruit and vegetables are good for you.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: something you say to greet somebody in the morning
word.entryExample: Good morning, class!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: something you say to somebody when you are leaving
word.entryExample: Goodbye, Mr Brown!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a child of your son or daughter
word.entryExample: She has four grandchildren.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the daughter of your son or daughter
word.entryExample: My granddaughter is two years old.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: an area of grass and flowers outside a house
word.entryExample: My grandfather lives on a farm.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: an informal word for 'grandmother'
word.entryExample: Grandma lives in London.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the mother of your mother or father
word.entryExample: My grandmother has grey hair and wears glasses.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: an informal word for 'grandfather'
word.entryExample: Grandpa is taking us to the zoo!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the parents of your mother or father
word.entryExample: I visit my grandparents during summer holiday.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the son of your son or daughter
word.entryExample: He's taking his grandson to the park.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a small round green or purple fruit which grows in bunches on a small tree
word.entryExample: There are some purple grapes or some green grapes.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a low plant with lots of thin green leaves that grows in a garden, park or field
word.entryExample: Cows eat a lot of grass.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: very good
word.entryExample: What a great story!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: something that is green is the colour of grass
word.entryExample: The walls in my room are green.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: something that is grey is the colour of dark clouds
word.entryExample: Elephants are grey.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the part of the surface of the earth that you walk on
word.entryExample: You mustn't sit on the ground.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the floor of a building at or nearest ground level
word.entryExample: The kitchen is on the ground floor of my house.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a musical instrument with strings, a wide body and a long neck, which you play with your fingers
word.entryExample: Alex got a new guitar for his birthday.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: your hair grows on the top of your head and keeps it warm
word.entryExample: He has short brown hair.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: 30 minutes after the hour
word.entryExample: I finish school at half past three.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: an animal like a large mouse with a short tail, often kept as a pet
word.entryExample: We have a pet hamster.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the part of the body at the end of your arm that you use to pick up or touch things
word.entryExample: Mum holds my hand when we cross the road.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a small bag that women often carry
word.entryExample: Is that red handbag yours?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to take place or or occur
word.entryExample: A funny thing happened at school today.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: feeling joy or pleasure
word.entryExample: Charlie is such a happy child.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a thing you wear on your head
word.entryExample: This is my hat.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to have a period of time between classes in which you can relax, have lunch, etc
word.entryExample: Why don't we have a break and go for a walk?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: must; used to show that it is necessary or very important that something happens in the present or future
word.entryExample: You have to go to school if you are younger than sixteen.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the condition of the body
word.entryExample: Good health is very important.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: free from illness
word.entryExample: I eat a lot of fruit to be healthy.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to sense sound with your ears
word.entryExample: Did you hear the good news?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a small brown mammal whose back is covered in spines, and which rolls up into a ball when it is afraid
word.entryExample: There's a hedgehog in the garden.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: something you say to greet somebody
word.entryExample: Hello, my name is Sam.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a hard item worn on the head to protect it
word.entryExample: Shall I bring the helmet for your bike?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to make it easier for someone to do something by doing some of it yourself, or by giving them something
word.entryExample: Can you help me put this suitcase on the top shelf?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to or at this place
word.entryExample: Tim, can you come here for a second?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: something informal you say to greet somebody
word.entryExample: Hi, how are you?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a long way above the ground
word.entryExample: What's the highest mountain in the world?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a very large African animal with short legs, a big head and a wide mouth that lives in and near water
word.entryExample: Hippos live in Africa.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: an activity that you regularly do in your free time for pleasure
word.entryExample: Can you tell me about your hobby, Lucy?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a team sport in which people try to hit a ball or puck into a goal using sticks
word.entryExample: Which hockey team do you support?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a period of time when you are not working and you can rest or go to another place to enjoy yourself
word.entryExample: Where did you go on holiday last year?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: reading and writing the teacher gives you to do at home
word.entryExample: I do my homework after school.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to jump using only one leg
word.entryExample: In the evening the frogs hop into the pound.
word.label: ydp
